It includes definitions of concepts (classes), attributes of these concepts (properties), and relationships between them.Concept: YearI. Entities / Classes:     1. Calendar Year: Represents one cycle of earth's revolution around the sun.     2. Fiscal Year: A year as reckoned for taxing or accounting.     3. Academic Year: A period of the year during which students attend educational institutions.     4. Leap Year: A year, occurring once every four years, which has 366 days including 29 February as an intercalary day.     5. Astronomical Year: Based on Earth's astronomical cycles.II. Properties / Attributes:     1. Duration: 365 or 366 days.     2. Months: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December.     3. Quarters: First Quarter (January, February, March), Second Quarter (April, May, June), Third Quarter (July, August, September), Fourth Quarter (October, November, December).     4. Number of Days: Each month has between 28 and 31 days.     5. Starting day and Ending day: Varies depending upon the type of year (e.g.: Calendar year starts from January 1st and ends at December 31st).III. Relationships:     1. Comprising: A year comprises of 12 months, 365/366 days, or 4 quarters.     2. Related to: Fiscal Year is related to Accounting & Financial Tasks, Academic Year is related to Schools, Colleges, and other educational institutions.     3. Based on: Astronomical Year is based on Earth's astronomical cycles.IV. Instances/Samples:     1. Year 2020: Instance of a leap year with 366 days.     2. Fiscal Year 21-22: An instance of the fiscal year (can vary based on nation's accounting and taxation rules).     3. Academic Year 2022-2023 in USA: Typically starting in August or September and continuing through May or June.     4. Julian year: An instance of Astronomical Year, equals to 365.25 days.
